winning_structure.name: UBX-CFG-PRT
winning_structure.description: Port configuration message. It can be used as a 1-byte poll request (payload contains only portID) or as a 20-byte configuration message for getting/setting port parameters. Multiple 20-byte configurations can be concatenated in an input message. This definition follows the UART port configuration as the primary structure.

fields.name: portID
fields.description: Port identifier number. Values: 0 for I2C (DDC), 1 for UART1, 2 for UART2, 3 for USB, 4 for SPI. This field determines the interpretation of subsequent payload fields.

fields.name: reserved0
fields.description: Reserved

fields.name: txReady
fields.description: TX ready PIN configuration (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01)

bits.name: en
bits.description: Enable TX ready feature for this port

bits.name: pol
bits.description: Polarity (0: High-active, 1: Low-active)

bits.name: pin
bits.description: PIO to be used (must not be in use by another function)

bits.name: thres
bits.description: Threshold (given threshold is multiplied by 8 bytes. The TX ready PIN goes active after >= thres*8 bytes are pending for the port and going inactive after the last pending bytes have been written to hardware (0-4 bytes before end of stream). Examples: 0x000 no threshold, 0x001 8byte, 0x002 16byte, 0x1FE 4080byte, 0x1FF 4088byte)

fields.name: mode
fields.description: This field's interpretation varies by port type. For UART ports (portID 1, 2), it describes the UART mode (see bitfield below). For SPI ports (portID 4), it describes SPI Mode Flags. For I2C ports (portID 0), it describes I2C (DDC) Mode Flags. For USB ports (portID 3), the entire 8-byte block from offset 4 to 11 is reserved.

bits.name: charLen
bits.description: Character length (00: 5bit (not supported), 01: 6bit (not supported), 10: 7bit (supported only with parity), 11: 8bit)

bits.name: parity
bits.description: Parity (000: Even parity, 001: Odd parity, 10X: No parity, X1X: Reserved)

bits.name: nStopBits
bits.description: Number of Stop bits (00: 1 Stop bit, 01: 1.5 Stop bit, 10: 2 Stop bit, 11: 0.5 Stop bit)

fields.name: baudRate
fields.description: Baud rate in bits/second (applies to UART ports, portID 1, 2). For other port types, this 4-byte block (offset 8-11) may be reserved or part of port-specific configuration not explicitly detailed as a distinct field.

fields.name: inProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: inUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: inNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: inRtcm
bits.description: RTCM2 protocol

bits.name: inRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

fields.name: outProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which output protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: outUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: outNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: outRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Flags bit mask

bits.name: extendedTxTimeout
bits.description: Extended TX timeout: if set, the port will time out if allocated TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5 s. If not set the port will time out if no activity for 1.5 s regardless on the amount of allocated TX memory (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01).

fields.name: reserved1
fields.description: Reserved

structure.name: UBX-CFG-PRT
structure.description: Port configuration message. It can be used as a 1-byte poll request (payload contains only portID) or as a 20-byte configuration message for getting/setting port parameters. Multiple 20-byte configurations can be concatenated in an input message. This definition follows the UART port configuration as the primary structure.

fields.name: portID
fields.description: Port identifier number. Values: 0 for I2C (DDC), 1 for UART1, 2 for UART2, 3 for USB, 4 for SPI. This field determines the interpretation of subsequent payload fields.

fields.name: reserved0
fields.description: Reserved

fields.name: txReady
fields.description: TX ready PIN configuration (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01)

bits.name: en
bits.description: Enable TX ready feature for this port

bits.name: pol
bits.description: Polarity (0: High-active, 1: Low-active)

bits.name: pin
bits.description: PIO to be used (must not be in use by another function)

bits.name: thres
bits.description: Threshold (given threshold is multiplied by 8 bytes. The TX ready PIN goes active after >= thres*8 bytes are pending for the port and going inactive after the last pending bytes have been written to hardware (0-4 bytes before end of stream). Examples: 0x000 no threshold, 0x001 8byte, 0x002 16byte, 0x1FE 4080byte, 0x1FF 4088byte)

fields.name: mode
fields.description: This field's interpretation varies by port type. For UART ports (portID 1, 2), it describes the UART mode (see bitfield below). For SPI ports (portID 4), it describes SPI Mode Flags. For I2C ports (portID 0), it describes I2C (DDC) Mode Flags. For USB ports (portID 3), the entire 8-byte block from offset 4 to 11 is reserved.

bits.name: charLen
bits.description: Character length (00: 5bit (not supported), 01: 6bit (not supported), 10: 7bit (supported only with parity), 11: 8bit)

bits.name: parity
bits.description: Parity (000: Even parity, 001: Odd parity, 10X: No parity, X1X: Reserved)

bits.name: nStopBits
bits.description: Number of Stop bits (00: 1 Stop bit, 01: 1.5 Stop bit, 10: 2 Stop bit, 11: 0.5 Stop bit)

fields.name: baudRate
fields.description: Baud rate in bits/second (applies to UART ports, portID 1, 2). For other port types, this 4-byte block (offset 8-11) may be reserved or part of port-specific configuration not explicitly detailed as a distinct field.

fields.name: inProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: inUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: inNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: inRtcm
bits.description: RTCM2 protocol

bits.name: inRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

fields.name: outProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which output protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: outUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: outNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: outRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Flags bit mask

bits.name: extendedTxTimeout
bits.description: Extended TX timeout: if set, the port will time out if allocated TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5 s. If not set the port will time out if no activity for 1.5 s regardless on the amount of allocated TX memory (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01).

fields.name: reserved1
fields.description: Reserved

structure.name: UBX-CFG-PRT
structure.description: Port configuration for I/O ports (UART, USB, SPI, I2C). This message is deprecated in protocol versions greater than 23.01. Use UBX-CFG-VALSET, UBX-CFG-VALGET, UBX-CFG-VALDEL instead.

fields.name: portID
fields.description: Port identifier number. Valid values depend on the port type: 0 for I2C (DDC), 1 for UART1, 2 for UART2, 3 for USB, 4 for SPI. See Integration manual for specific port IDs.

fields.name: reserved0
fields.description: Reserved

fields.name: txReady
fields.description: TX ready PIN configuration (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01)

bits.name: en
bits.description: Enable TX ready feature for this port

bits.name: pol
bits.description: Polarity (0 High-active, 1 Low-active)

bits.name: pin
bits.description: PIO to be used (must not be in use by another function)

bits.name: thres
bits.description: Threshold (given threshold is multiplied by 8 bytes. The TX ready PIN goes active after >= thres*8 bytes are pending for the port and going inactive after the last pending bytes have been written to hardware (0-4 bytes before end of stream). 0x000 no threshold, 0x001 8byte, ..., 0x1FF 4088byte)

fields.name: mode
fields.description: Mode flags for the respective port. Interpretation varies depending on portID. This bitfield definition reflects UART mode flags (portID = 1 or 2). For SPI (portID = 4), mode contains spiMode and ffCnt. For I2C (portID = 0), mode contains slaveAddr.

bits.name: charLen
bits.description: Character length (00 5bit (not supported), 01 6bit (not supported), 10 7bit (supported only with parity), 11 8bit)

bits.name: parity
bits.description: Parity (000 Even parity, 001 Odd parity, 10X No parity, X1X Reserved)

bits.name: nStopBits
bits.description: Number of Stop bits (00 1 Stop bit, 01 1.5 Stop bit, 10 2 Stop bit, 11 0.5 Stop bit)

fields.name: baudRate
fields.description: Baud rate in bits/second. This field is specific to UART ports; other port types (USB, SPI, I2C) typically use these bytes as reserved fields ('reserved1').

fields.name: inProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: inUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: inNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: inRtcm
bits.description: RTCM2 protocol

bits.name: inRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

fields.name: outProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which output protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: outUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: outNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: outRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Flags bit mask

bits.name: extendedTxTimeout
bits.description: Extended TX timeout: if set, the port will time out if allocated TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5 s. If not set the port will time out if no activity for 1.5 s regardless on the amount of allocated TX memory (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01).

fields.name: reserved1
fields.description: Reserved

fields.description: Port identifier number

fields.name: reserved0

bits.name: pin

bits.name: thres
bits.description: Threshold (multiplied by 8 bytes; 0x000: no threshold, 0x001: 8byte, 0x002: 16byte, ..., 0x1FE: 4080byte, 0x1FF: 4088byte)

fields.name: mode
fields.description: A bit mask describing the UART mode

fields.name: baudRate
fields.description: Baud rate in bits/second

fields.name: inProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: inNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: inRtcm
bits.description: RTCM2 protocol

bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

fields.name: outProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which output protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: outUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: outNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: outRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

fields.name: flags

bits.name: extendedTxTimeout
bits.description: Extended TX timeout: if set, the port will time out if allocated TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5 s. If not set the port will time out if no activity for 1.5 s regardless on the amount of allocated TX memory (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01).

fields.name: reserved3
fields.description: Reserved

structure.name: UBX-CFG-PRT
structure.description: Port configuration for I/O ports. This message is deprecated in protocol versions greater than 23.01. Use UBX-CFG-VALSET, UBX-CFG-VALGET, UBX-CFG-VALDEL instead. The payload structure varies based on the portID field.

fields.name: portID
fields.description: Port identifier number (0=I2C, 1=UART1, 2=UART2, 3=USB, 4=SPI. See integration manual for valid port IDs).

fields.name: reserved0
fields.description: Reserved.

fields.name: txReady
fields.description: TX ready PIN configuration (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01).

bits.name: en
bits.description: Enable TX ready feature for this port.

bits.name: pol
bits.description: Polarity (0=High-active, 1=Low-active).

bits.name: pin
bits.description: PIO to be used (must not be in use by another function).

bits.name: thres
bits.description: Threshold. The given threshold is multiplied by 8 bytes. (0x000 no threshold, 0x001 8byte, 0x002 16byte, ..., 0x1FE 4080byte, 0x1FF 4088byte).

fields.name: mode
fields.description: A bit mask describing the UART mode. (Interpretation varies based on portID. For SPI, it contains spiMode and ffCnt. For I2C, it contains slaveAddr. Other bits may be reserved for non-UART ports.)

bits.name: charLen
bits.description: Character length (00=5bit, 01=6bit, 10=7bit, 11=8bit).

bits.name: parity
bits.description: Parity (000=Even parity, 001=Odd parity, 10X=No parity, X1X=Reserved).

bits.name: nStopBits
bits.description: Number of Stop bits (00=1 Stop bit, 01=1.5 Stop bit, 10=2 Stop bit, 11=0.5 Stop bit).

fields.name: baudRate
fields.description: Baud rate in bits/second (Applicable for UART only. For USB/SPI/I2C, this field is reserved).

fields.name: inProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port. (The bitfield inRtcm3 is not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00).

bits.name: inUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol.

bits.name: inNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol.

bits.name: inRtcm
bits.description: RTCM2 protocol.

bits.name: inRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00).

fields.name: outProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which output protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port. (The bitfield outRtcm3 is not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00).

bits.name: outUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol.

bits.name: outNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol.

bits.name: outRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00).

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Flags bit mask.

bits.name: extendedTxTimeout
bits.description: Extended TX timeout: if set, the port will time out if allocated TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5 s. (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01). (Applicable for UART/USB/SPI. Reserved for I2C.)

fields.name: reserved1_at_18
fields.description: Reserved.

fields.name: portID
fields.description: Port identifier number (see Integration manual for valid UART port IDs)

fields.description: Reserved

structure.name: UBX-CFG-PRT
structure.description: Polls the configuration for one I/O port

fields.name: portID
fields.description: Port identifier number (see the other versions of CFG-PRT for valid values)

structure.name: UBX-CFG-PRT
structure.description: Polls or configures the port settings for an I/O port (e.g., UART, USB, SPI). This definition describes the 20-byte Get/Set configuration.

fields.name: portID
fields.description: Port identifier number (see the other versions of CFG-PRT for valid values)

fields.name: reserved1
fields.description: Reserved

fields.name: txReady
fields.description: TX ready PIN configuration

bits.name: en
bits.description: Enable TX ready feature for this port

bits.name: pol
bits.description: Polarity (0 High-active, 1 Low-active)

bits.name: pin
bits.description: PIO to be used (must not be in use by another function)

bits.name: thres
bits.description: Threshold for TX ready PIN activation. The given threshold is multiplied by 8 bytes. Values like 0x000 (no threshold), 0x001 (8 bytes), 0x002 (16 bytes), ..., 0x1FE (4080 bytes), 0x1FF (4088 bytes).

fields.name: mode
fields.description: A bit mask describing the UART mode

bits.name: charLen
bits.description: Character length (00 5bit (not supported), 01 6bit (not supported), 10 7bit (supported only with parity), 11 8bit)

bits.name: parity
bits.description: Parity setting (000 Even parity, 001 Odd parity, 10X No parity, X1X Reserved)

bits.name: nStopBits
bits.description: Number of Stop bits (00 1 Stop bit, 01 1.5 Stop bit, 10 2 Stop bit, 11 0.5 Stop bit)

fields.name: baudRate
fields.description: Baud rate in bits/second

fields.name: inProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: inUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: inNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: inRtcm
bits.description: RTCM2 protocol

bits.name: inRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported in protocol versions less than 20)

fields.name: outProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which output protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: outUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: outNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: outRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported in protocol versions less than 20)

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Flags bit mask

bits.name: extendedTxTimeout
bits.description: Extended TX timeout: if set, the port will time out if allocated TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5 s. If not set the port will time out if no activity for 1.5 s regardless on the amount of allocated TX memory.

fields.name: reserved2
fields.description: Reserved
